intro: Neochilenia taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal thistle, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Neochilenia taltalensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
